column4: if you can definately ssh in from other machines on your LAN. the problem has to be with your router settings

: i am using ssh+screen+irssi now, so yes i am sshing over wlan. but the router should be configured correctly according to http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Dlink/DI-614+/SSH.htm. any thoughts?
you could test out the route using the DMZ feature of your router

DMZ simultaniously forwards all ports to your selected PC, it is therefore very insucure - however assuming your machine is not for production use and is not running any other services you should be safe to test it
: i have done that as well, i added my internal ip to the dmz, so everything should be forwarded to my box, but still it didn't work. :-/ (i have removed it now though)
very strange then.  I would be tempted to reset the router and run through the steps from scratch
: already done that. ;-) (been trying for a long time now :-/)
port forwarding is usually very simple to do, it sounds like you know what you are doing and are hitting a router glicth here
the only possibility i can think of is that your ISP blocks the port you are attempting to use - this is very rare though, only normally done with email
: meh! :-( will try to see if i can find something about the router being buggy or something, it's an old model, unsupported though. thanks for your time/help. :-)
: i have tryed using port 22, 2277, and the one im currently using.
it is possible for an ISP to block all ports except for web traffic ones - ie 80 and 443
so you could try connecting over those, and port forward port 80 to port 22 for example
: ok, i really don't think nextgentel is blocking anything, but im willing to try. :-)

another thing you could try is to take the router out of the equation and connect your box directly to WAN, this would prove the problme is the router.  However you can only do this if your modem etc is seperate to the router of course
: true, i should do that, but i dont have any cables lying around. :-P i should go and get one tommorow.
